entry.title: New release for PortNote: v1.1.0
entry.content:
[!CAUTION]
With the new update, the docker compose has also changed considerably by adding a new cotnainer ‚Äúportnote-agent‚Äù. For existing installations, please also adjust your docker compose!

[‚≠ê] - New Features - Auto Port Detection - At the touch of a button, servers are now automatically scanned for all ports in use. You no longer have to type them all in individually - Port generator - The port generator now only generates ports that arent already used - Small UI Improvements - Added a footer with version number and improved port badges.

[üêõ] - Bug Fixes - Fixed a bug where deleting ports did not work as intended. - Fixed a bug where servers vanished when edited to be a VM of another server.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/crocofied/PortNote/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0

To update, simply pull the latest docker images.

entry.title: New release for PortNote: v1.2.0
entry.content:
[‚≠ê] New Features - Foldable Servers: You can now collapse servers to hide their ports. #2 - Highlighted Ports: When hovering over a port, it is now highlighted for better visibility on wide monitors. The layout has also been adjusted to display two ports per line. #3 - Server Sorting: Servers and VMs can now be sorted alphabetically or by IP. #13 - Port Hyperlinks: Clicking on a port now opens the IP and port in a new tab. #15 - Improved Accessibility: Enhanced screen reader support. #9

[üêõ] Bug Fixes - Docker Compose Fix: PortNote and PortNote-agent now wait for the database to start, preventing errors during initial launch. #8 - Port Cleanup: Removing a server or VM now also deletes its associated ports from the database. #21

Full Changelog: https://github.com/crocofied/PortNote/compare/v1.1.0...v1.2.0

To update, simply pull the latest docker images.
